image.altText: A close-up of a bald man wearing glasses, a navy blazer and white shirt.

props.synopsis: As Sangeev Gupta’s global empire lurches from one crisis to the next, the metals tycoon has told ABC News he’s committed to returning Whyalla’s steelworks to profitability, again promising a $1 billion transition to making green steel at the plant.

title.children: He's down a billion dollars, but the owner of Whyalla steelworks isn’t giving up on the pursuit of profitability

image.altText: Adelaide United assistant coach Travis Dodd and defender Bailey O'Neil

props.synopsis: The current A-League Men's competition has less than a handful of Indigenous players, but emerging talent Bailey O'Neil and mentor Travis Dodd want to "get that ball rolling" when it comes to improving pathways.

title.children: Bailey O'Neil is one of just three Indigenous players in the A-League Men — he hopes to inspire more

image.altText: a man in a business suit walks outside a court building

props.synopsis: A South Australian family says they forgive an Italian tourist whose "terrible error" caused a crash which killed three of their relatives in the state's Mid North last year, and say they do not believe he should be jailed.

title.children: Family forgives Italian tourist for 'serious lapse' which caused triple-fatal crash

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair wearing a pink and tan dress leans on a marble kitchen bench smiling and looking off camera.

props.synopsis: The cook was named Best Host of a TV Format Award at the C21 International Format Awards for the ABC show Maggie Beer's Big Mission, a project aiming to overhaul the aged care industry's dismal catering.

title.children: Maggie Beer wins international TV award, beating industry legends Jimmy Kimmel and Stephen Fry

image.altText: Workers using a reach truck to repair power lines at a tall electricity tower

props.synopsis: The tribunal overseeing energy prices in New South Wales is investigating whether power infrastructure company Transgrid failed to provide a reliable supply to residents in the far west after a second outage within a week.

title.children: Investigation launched, power back on after backup generator failed in Broken Hill

image.altText: Hainsworth interview

props.synopsis: Steven Hainsworth was arrested in 2019, 21 years after allegedly murdering the first of three victims. He has spent the past two months listening intently to evidence from the Supreme Court dock.

title.children: From arrest to trial, this is how the case of an accused serial killer unfolded

image.altText: Woman speaking into microphone outside parliament house.

props.synopsis: University of Adelaide law academic Joanna Howe has posted to social media labelling female politicians 'baby killers' following a failure to change South Australian abortion laws.

title.children: Anti-abortion activist brands female politicians 'baby killers' in social media post

image.altText: An image of a person driving with a dog on their lap while using their mobile phone.

props.synopsis: South Australian Police says at least 80 drivers could lose their licences after being caught illegally using a mobile phone four or more times behind the wheel.

title.children: Police say 80 drivers could lose their licences after being caught by detection cameras in one month

image.altText: A composite of Donald Trump and Kamala Harris against a backdrop of a globe.

props.synopsis: From war in the Middle East and Europe, to the geo-strategic complexities of our own region, America's election outcome will change the world. Our ABC correspondents break down what could follow either a Donald Trump or Kamala Harris victory.

title.children: The world stands at a crossroads. Our foreign correspondents predict where Trump or Harris could take us next

image.altText: Man stands at podium addressing room

props.synopsis: Brian Bieber, the lawyer for Mr Jeffries, had earlier said in an interview that his client would plead not guilty to all counts he faces.

title.children: Former Abercrombie & Fitch CEO Mike Jeffries pleads not guilty to sex trafficking charges

image.altText: Four SpaceX astronauts dressed in blue jumpsuits stand alongside each other in single file, smiling

props.synopsis: Three astronauts and one cosmonaut have returned to Earth after nearly eight months on the International Space Station, which was extended by Boeing's capsule trouble and Hurricane Milton.

title.children: SpaceX capsule returns four astronauts to Earth but Boeing Starliner crew remain on ISS

image.altText: The main street of Broken Hill in the dark with stars shining overhead.

props.synopsis: More than a week after a possible tornado tore through Broken Hill and wiped out seven transmission towers, the region is still grappling with rolling blackouts that are putting dialysis patients like Leroy and year 12 students studying for exams like Poppy on edge.

title.children: The town where 'power could go off any minute' grapples with continual outages

image.altText: Caitlin Foord of Australia controls the ball under pressure from Geraldine Reuteler during an international friendly

props.synopsis: The Matildas' new era has begun with a 1-1 draw against Switzerland, in front of a record crowd in Zurich.

title.children: Matildas with work to do after 1-1 draw with Switzerland

image.altText: a young woman looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Maddie was 19 when the hot flashes and mood swings started.

title.children: Menopause in her early 20s made Maddie feel she was losing her youth and womanhood

image.altText: Oscar Piastri in the garage, putting in ear plugs before he goes out to race

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has been quick to shut down growing suggestions that his management team are manoeuvring for him to make a move from McLaren to Red Bull.

title.children: Piastri shuts down talk of move from McLaren to champions Red Bull

image.altText: A black and white photo of two young men standing outside a house

props.synopsis: The Menendez brothers' case gripped America in the 1990s. Here is how these two brothers went from being the arch-villains of the country's burgeoning true crime obsession, to the focus of an impassioned movement to free them.

title.children: Maligned as greedy ‘crybaby’ killers, the Menendez brothers have a new chance at freedom. Here's what changed

image.altText: Clive Palmer with white hair wearing white shirt against blue water, sail boat and houses addressing media

props.synopsis: Hundreds of former and current police officers and staff members have launched a class action lawsuit against the state government and the Queensland Police Service, over its COVID-19 vaccine mandates.

title.children: Bankrolled by Clive Palmer, hundreds of police officers and staff launch class action over vaccine mandates

image.altText: Adam Bray, right, and Zach Bray who died in the hunter bus crash of June 11, 2023

props.synopsis: The father of a man killed in the crash is leading a class action against Transport for NSW, in which claim documents suggest the roundabout's "tightening radius" contributed to the tragedy.

title.children: Roundabout design and 'inadequate' signage key to Hunter Valley bus crash victims' class action

image.altText: A render of a ship's cabin with large rectangular porthole, beige couch and dog bed.

props.synopsis: Tasmania finds itself in a farcical position where the brand-new Spirit of Tasmania ferries it purchased may end up being hand-me-downs by the time they reach the state's shores.

title.children: Tasmanians will have to sit back and watch someone else use their $850m brand-new Spirit ferries

image.altText: An AI image of a man in a radio station

props.synopsis: One of Poland's leading state broadcasters has come under fire after it launched a new radio program presented solely by artificial intelligence (AI) presenters, weeks after dismissing dozens of creators.

title.children: This Polish radio station dismissed its presenters and turned to AI. Then they interviewed a dead poet

image.altText: A screengrab of a webpage showing flights over the Middle East.

props.synopsis: As Israel and Iran trade blows in the Middle East, commercial aircraft traversing the region are doing so through fewer corridors to avoid getting caught in the crossfire.

title.children: Missiles flying between Israel and Iran have the aviation industry concerned about getting caught in the crossfire

image.altText: Tim Heath sitting in an office.

props.synopsis: Australian billionaire Tim Heath survived a kidnapping attempt by fighting off his alleged abductors who had pretended to be tradies painting the hallway of his apartment building.

title.children: Australian billionaire Tim Heath fights off alleged abductors dressed as painters in his apartment building

image.altText: David Warner holds his bat up to the crowd as he leaves the field

props.synopsis: Letters of reference from current and former Australia captains, as well as coach Andrew McDonald and New Zealand great Kane Williamson help convince a Cricket Australia panel to end David Warner's ban on holding leadership positions, dating back to the 2018 ball-tampering saga.

title.children: Warner's 'Sandpaper-gate' lifetime ban ended after Cummins, Chappell, Sthalekar go in to bat for him

image.altText: Damaged car parked in front of house with broken window

props.synopsis: A community meeting has been held in Meekatharra to address what police describe as a recent increase in youth-related crime and antisocial behaviour.

title.children: 'There is no control': Outback residents' frustration amid uptick in juvenile crime

image.altText: A side profile of an Indigenous woman with a painted face.

props.synopsis: Arthurina Moreen's desire was so great to play footy, she'd practice by kicking bottles with her bare feet. A new documentary has shone a light on her resilience, and that of three other Tiwi Islander women as they chase AFLW stardom.

title.children: 'I started by kicking bottles': Documentary follows young Indigenous women chasing AFLW dreams

image.altText: A massive pile of cannabis on fire

props.synopsis: More than 6,500 cannabis plants have been seized in the Gippsland region and burned in what police say is one of the biggest hauls in recent time.

title.children: Police seize $26 million illegal cannabis crop in country Victoria

image.altText: A yellow metal bar gate with the nuclear symbol on it

props.synopsis: Taiwan is months away from phasing out its last nuclear plant, and while some are happy, others question how the tech powerhouse will power itself.

title.children: Taiwan's only months away from shutting off all nuclear power, but some question whether the tech powerhouse is ready

props.synopsis: Grain and oilseed growers in northern NSW look to the skies and hope the weather cooperates to produce a stand-out harvest this year with the success credited to a full moisture profile at sowing and consistent and timely rain throughout the growing season.

title.children: Grain growers in northern NSW say this season's crops could be 'spectacular'

image.altText: Lucy Letby appears by video link during an appeal against her conviction

props.synopsis: Letby, 34, is serving multiple life sentences with no chance of release after being convicted of murdering seven babies during shifts as a nurse in a British hospital.

title.children: British killer nurse Lucy Letby loses appeal bid for latest murder conviction

image.altText: Jim and Carmel Madden pictured smiling.

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to reports a truck veered from the road and crashed into a house on the Princes Highway just after 7am. A man and woman in their 80s inside the house died at the scene.

title.children: 'Totally devastated' family mourns couple killed in bedroom after truck veers off highway in Victoria's south-west

image.altText: Man loses his popcorn because he gets startled with fright

props.synopsis: From a twisted take on Freaky Friday to a deeply satisfying 'eat the rich' fable, here are some Halloween movies that might give you a jolt but won't keep you up at night.

title.children: Too scared to watch horror movies? Here are 5 to ease you into the genre

image.altText: Close-up of moldy bread slices, showcasing the detailed texture and various colors of mold growth on the surface.

props.synopsis: Have you ever been tempted to cut off a mouldy corner of cheese? You might be throwing together a last-minute meal and trying to avoid a trip to the shops. Maybe one of your parents would insist it was "still good". But is it?

title.children: Tempted to cut mould off cheese or scrape some off jam? Here's what the experts have to say about it

image.altText: King Charles III chats with owner of alpaca.

props.synopsis: It's that time of the week again. Think you've been paying attention to the news?

title.children: Weekly news quiz: King Charles gets sneezed on, a strong man's secret hobby and Donald Trump's drive-thru

image.altText: Liz Watson and Gretel Bueta of Australia hugging after winning netball gold medal

props.synopsis: Glasgow has stepped up to host the 2026 Commonwealth Games but with just over half the number of sports remaining and cost blowouts putting off other countries, do the Games have a future?

title.children: Will Glasgow 2026 be the last Commonwealth Games?
